name: Your First Stamp
address: Anywhere in the world
about: Welcome to Stampbook! This is your first special stamp that you can claim from anywhere.
notesFromOthers: Welcome to the community! üéâ
This is where your journey begins!
thingsToDoFromEditors: Tap Collect Stamp
Explore the world

name: Baker Beach
address:
1504 Pershing Dr
San Francisco, CA, USA 94129
about: A public beach with stunning Golden Gate Bridge views.
notesFromOthers: Great spot for photos of the Golden Gate Bridge!
Battery Chamberlin trail gives amazing panoramic views
thingsToDoFromEditors: Bring a wide-angle lens for Golden Gate Bridge photos from the north end
Walk the Battery Chamberlin Trail above the beach for fort ruins and bridge views

name: Dolores Park
address:
Dolores St & 19th St
San Francisco, CA, USA 94114
about: Local favorite park with wide open grassy areas perfect for dogs and people watching.
notesFromOthers: The off-leash area is so fun to watch! Bring your pup
20th & Church St corner has the best sunset skyline views
thingsToDoFromEditors: Grab takeout from Bi-Rite Market across the street for a picnic on the upper lawn
Visit the southwest corner at sunset for unobstructed downtown skyline views

name: Pier 39
address:
Beach St & The Embarcadero
San Francisco, CA, USA 94133
about: Popular waterfront marketplace famous for resident sea lions, shops, and stunning bay views.
notesFromOthers: The sea lions are absolutely adorable - must see!
Amazing views of Alcatraz and the Golden Gate Bridge
thingsToDoFromEditors: Visit K-Dock on the west side to see the famous barking sea lions up close
Walk to the end of the pier for Alcatraz and Golden Gate Bridge photo ops

name: Ferry Building
address:
1 Ferry Building
San Francisco, CA, USA 94111
about: Historic terminal and marketplace with artisan food vendors and iconic clock tower.
notesFromOthers: Saturday farmers market is incredible - best produce!
Blue Bottle Coffee inside is perfect for a bay view
The architecture and clock tower are stunning
thingsToDoFromEditors: Browse the Saturday farmers market (8am-2pm) for California's best local produce
Sample oysters at Hog Island Oyster Co. with bay views through the windows

name: Oracle Park
address:
24 Willie Mays Plaza
San Francisco, CA, USA 94107
about: Home of the San Francisco Giants and one of baseball's most beautiful ballparks.
notesFromOthers: Even non-baseball fans love this place!
Get garlic fries - they're legendary
Walking around outside on game days is free and fun
thingsToDoFromEditors: Order garlic fries and crab sandwich - two ballpark food legends
Walk along McCovey Cove outside the park to watch boats during games

name: Twin Peaks
address:
501 Twin Peaks Blvd
San Francisco, CA, USA 94114
about: One of the highest points in the city with 360-degree panoramic views.
notesFromOthers: Best sunrise/sunset spot in SF - absolutely stunning
Bring layers - it's always windy and cold up here!
Clear days you can see all the way to the East Bay
thingsToDoFromEditors: Arrive 30 minutes before sunset and bring layers - it gets windy and cold
Walk the full loop around both peaks for 360-degree city views

name: Japantown
address:
1610 Geary Blvd
San Francisco, CA, USA 94115
about: One of the oldest Japanese communities in the US with authentic restaurants and shops.
notesFromOthers: Amazing ramen and Japanese curry here!
Kinokuniya bookstore is a must-visit
Cherry blossom season in spring is magical
thingsToDoFromEditors: Try authentic ramen at Nojo Ramen or Japanese curry at Curry House CoCo Ichibanya
Browse Japanese stationery and snacks at Kinokuniya bookstore in the mall

name: Powell-Hyde Cable Car
address:
Powell St & Market St
San Francisco, CA, USA 94102
about: One of San Francisco's most scenic cable car routes with stunning bay views.
notesFromOthers: Ride the outside running board for the full experience!
The view coming down Hyde Street is incredible
Get there early - lines get super long
thingsToDoFromEditors: Board at Powell & Market early morning to avoid 2-hour waits
Stand on the outer running board going down Hyde Street for thrilling bay views

name: Palace of Fine Arts
address:
3601 Lyon St
San Francisco, CA, USA 94123
about: Stunning Greco-Roman monument with a rotunda and lagoon built for the 1915 Exposition.
notesFromOthers: Feels like you're in ancient Greece!
Sunset photography here is unbeatable
Great for picnics by the lagoon
thingsToDoFromEditors: Visit at golden hour for stunning light on the rotunda reflected in the lagoon
Walk around the entire lagoon to find different angles of the columns

name: Painted Ladies
address:
710-720 Steiner St
San Francisco, CA, USA 94117
about: Iconic row of Victorian houses at Alamo Square, famous from Full House.
notesFromOthers: The Full House houses! Perfect photo op
Alamo Square park is great for picnics
Golden hour light makes them glow beautifully
thingsToDoFromEditors: Shoot from the Alamo Square lawn in late afternoon when the houses glow golden
Bring a picnic blanket and snacks to enjoy the view from the park

name: Golden Gate Viewpoint
address:
Old Conzelman Rd
Mill Valley, CA, USA 94941
about: Breathtaking elevated views of the Golden Gate Bridge from the Marin Headlands.
notesFromOthers: Worth the drive - totally different perspective!
The winding road up is an adventure itself
Best sunset views of the Golden Gate Bridge anywhere
thingsToDoFromEditors: Drive up Conzelman Road to Battery Spencer for the most dramatic bridge angle
Arrive at sunset when the bridge glows orange against the Pacific

name: Equator Coffee
address:
986 Lombard St
San Francisco, CA, USA 94133
about: Specialty coffee roaster known for sustainability and direct trade relationships.
notesFromOthers: Their single-origin pour-over is phenomenal!
Perfect pit stop before heading to the Golden Gate Bridge
thingsToDoFromEditors: Order the single-origin pour-over to taste their roasting expertise
Stop here on your way to the Golden Gate Bridge - it's perfectly located

name: The Coffee Movement
address:
1399 9th Ave
San Francisco, CA, USA 94122
about: Inner Sunset neighborhood favorite serving carefully sourced coffee.
notesFromOthers: The oat milk latte with house blend is *chef's kiss*
Golden Gate Park is just 2 blocks away - perfect combo
thingsToDoFromEditors: Grab coffee here before exploring Golden Gate Park two blocks north
Try their oat milk latte with pastries from Arizmendi across the street

name: Andytown Coffee Roasters
address:
3655 Lawton St
San Francisco, CA, USA 94122
about: Coffee roasters near Ocean Beach famous for the Snowy Plover affogato.
notesFromOthers: Snowy Plover is a MUST - best affogato in the city
Take it to Ocean Beach 2 blocks away for the vibes
thingsToDoFromEditors: Order the Snowy Plover (brown sugar ice cream + espresso) - their signature drink
Take your drink to Ocean Beach two blocks away for sunset

name: Neighbor Bakehouse
address:
2343 3rd St
San Francisco, CA, USA 94107
about: Dogpatch bakehouse combining excellent coffee with fresh-baked pastries.
notesFromOthers: Butter croissant is perfection - get there early!
Walk it off at the Dogpatch waterfront nearby
thingsToDoFromEditors: Arrive early for warm croissants - they sell out by noon
Walk to the Dogpatch waterfront along 3rd Street after your coffee

name: The Mill
address:
736 Divisadero St
San Francisco, CA, USA 94117
about: Famous for Four Barrel coffee and house-made artisan toast.
notesFromOthers: Avocado toast on Josey Baker bread is legendary
Alamo Square & Painted Ladies are walking distance!
thingsToDoFromEditors: Order the cinnamon sugar toast - their iconic signature item
Walk to Alamo Square and the Painted Ladies 10 minutes away

name: Saint Frank Coffee
address:
2340 Polk St
San Francisco, CA, USA 94109
about: Bright, minimalist Russian Hill caf√© serving meticulously sourced coffee.
notesFromOthers: Their rotating single-origin espresso is incredible
Staff are super knowledgeable about their sourcing
thingsToDoFromEditors: Ask baristas about their rotating single-origin espresso - they love sharing details
Try the cortado to experience their roasting at its purest

name: Sightglass Coffee
address:
270 7th St
San Francisco, CA, USA 94103
about: Spacious SoMa warehouse caf√© where they roast their own beans on-site.
notesFromOthers: Watching them roast through the windows is so cool
Espresso tonic on a sunny day = perfection
thingsToDoFromEditors: Watch them roast coffee through the glass-walled roasting room
Try the espresso tonic on warm days - refreshing and caffeinated

name: Four Barrel Coffee
address:
375 Valencia St
San Francisco, CA, USA 94103
about: Beloved Mission District roaster known for quality and direct trade.
notesFromOthers: Classic drip coffee showcases their roasting mastery
Mission murals nearby are absolutely worth seeing
thingsToDoFromEditors: Order classic drip coffee to taste their legendary roasting
Explore Clarion Alley's murals one block away at Valencia & 17th

name: Pinhole Coffee
address:
231 Fillmore St
San Francisco, CA, USA 94117
about: Cozy, intimate Lower Haight caf√© for specialty coffee.
notesFromOthers: Flat white here is meticulously crafted - so smooth
Vintage shops on Haight are great for browsing after
thingsToDoFromEditors: Sip their perfectly crafted flat white at the window bar
Browse vintage shops on Haight Street a few blocks east

name: Ballast Coffee
address:
798 Florida St
San Francisco, CA, USA 94110
about: Mission caf√© serving thoughtfully sourced coffee in a minimalist space.
notesFromOthers: Great vibe for working remotely - good wifi!
Tartine Bakery is nearby for pastries ü•ê
thingsToDoFromEditors: Grab coffee here then walk to Tartine Bakery for morning buns
Bring your laptop - the wifi is solid and the vibe is calm

name: Japanese Tea Garden
address:
75 Hagiwara Tea Garden Dr
San Francisco, CA, USA 94118
about: The oldest public Japanese garden in the US with pagodas, koi ponds, and tea house.
notesFromOthers: Visit early morning for peaceful moments before crowds
The drum bridge and moon bridge are stunning photo spots
Fortune cookies were invented here!
thingsToDoFromEditors: Arrive right at opening (9am) for serene photos before crowds
Stop at the tea house for traditional tea and fortune cookies

name: Three Gems by James Turrell
address:
50 Hagiwara Tea Garden Dr
San Francisco, CA, USA 94118
about: Hidden James Turrell skyspace installation inside the de Young Museum.
notesFromOthers: Most people miss this - it's tucked in the museum!
Best at sunrise or sunset when the sky colors shift
Lie down and watch the sky transform - it's magical
thingsToDoFromEditors: Free admission before 10am on Saturdays - perfect for experiencing Three Gems
Lie on the benches and watch the sky change through the skyspace opening

name: Portals of the Past
address:
John F. Kennedy Dr & 6th Ave
San Francisco, CA, USA 94118
about: Marble columns from a Nob Hill mansion destroyed in the 1906 earthquake.
notesFromOthers: So eerie and beautiful - feels like ancient ruins
Perfect golden hour photography spot
The reflection in Lloyd Lake is incredible
thingsToDoFromEditors: Photograph the columns reflected in Lloyd Lake at sunrise
Walk around the lake to see the columns from different perspectives

name: Conservatory of Flowers
address:
100 John F. Kennedy Dr
San Francisco, CA, USA 94118
about: Victorian greenhouse and oldest building in Golden Gate Park with rare tropical plants.
notesFromOthers: The building itself is a work of art!
So humid inside - like stepping into a rainforest
Night lights during holidays are absolutely magical
thingsToDoFromEditors: Visit the Aquatic Plants room to see giant water lilies and carnivorous plants
Come during holiday season for spectacular light displays on the building

name: Bison Paddock
address:
John F. Kennedy Dr & Chain of Lakes Dr
San Francisco, CA, USA 94121
about: Home to a herd of American bison since 1891 in Golden Gate Park.
notesFromOthers: Can't believe there are actual buffalo in SF!
Best viewing in the morning when they're active
Bring binoculars - they sometimes graze far back
thingsToDoFromEditors: Visit early morning (7-9am) when bison are most active and near the fence
Bring binoculars if they're grazing in the back of the paddock

name: Fort Mason Community Garden
address:
2 Marina Blvd
San Francisco, CA, USA 94123
about: Terraced community garden at Fort Mason with stunning waterfront views.
notesFromOthers: The bay views from here are incredible!
Such a peaceful spot in the city
Love seeing what everyone is growing
thingsToDoFromEditors: Walk through the terraced gardens then continue to Fort Mason waterfront
Visit in spring/summer to see the gardens at their most lush

name: Bernal Heights Community Garden
address:
Folsom St & Ellsworth St
San Francisco, CA, USA 94110
about: Vibrant neighborhood garden with organic plots and fruit trees.
notesFromOthers: The neighborhood vibe here is amazing
Great place to learn about urban gardening
The fruit trees are so productive!
thingsToDoFromEditors: Check the bulletin board for free gardening workshops and events
Hike up Bernal Hill right after for 360-degree city views

name: Garden for the Environment
address:
7th Ave & Lawton St
San Francisco, CA, USA 94122
about: Educational garden teaching sustainable practices with workshops and native plants.
notesFromOthers: The workshops here are fantastic!
So many great ideas for sustainable gardening
Kids love the educational programs
thingsToDoFromEditors: Sign up for a free weekend workshop on composting or native plants
Explore the native plant section for California gardening ideas

name: Clipper Terrace Community Garden
address:
Clipper St & Douglass St
San Francisco, CA, USA 94114
about: Hillside terraced garden with panoramic city views and colorful flowers.
notesFromOthers: The city views while gardening are unbeatable
Really friendly community of gardeners
Love the terraced layout on the hillside
thingsToDoFromEditors: Walk the terraced paths for unique city views between the garden plots
Visit in peak summer for the most colorful flower displays

name: Potrero Hill Community Garden
address:
Utah St & 20th St
San Francisco, CA, USA 94107
about: One of San Francisco's oldest community gardens, established in the 1970s.
notesFromOthers: Historic garden with so much character
The sunny microclimate is perfect for growing
Community events here are wonderful
thingsToDoFromEditors: Explore the garden then grab lunch at nearby Chez Maman on 18th
Visit during monthly open houses to meet gardeners and learn tips

name: Alemany Farm
address:
700 Alemany Blvd
San Francisco, CA, USA 94110
about: San Francisco's largest urban farm spanning 3.5 acres with stunning views.
notesFromOthers: Amazing that this exists in the city!
The volunteer days are so rewarding
Best views of SF from a farm
thingsToDoFromEditors: Join Saturday volunteer mornings (10am) to help with planting and harvesting
Take in the sweeping city views from this hilltop farm

name: Howard Langton Community Garden
address:
Howard St & Langton St
San Francisco, CA, USA 94103
about: Hidden SoMa garden known for creative vertical space and container gardening.
notesFromOthers: A secret garden in the heart of SoMa!
Impressive what they grow in such a small space
Great inspiration for small-space gardening
thingsToDoFromEditors: Study their vertical gardening techniques for small-space inspiration
Peek through the fence even when closed to see creative container gardens

name: Bubble Rock
address:
Bubble Rock Trail
Bar Harbor, ME, USA 04609
about: Massive 50-ton glacial boulder perched on South Bubble Mountain.
notesFromOthers: The hike up is moderate and totally worth it!
Amazing views of Jordan Pond from here
Take the classic 'holding up the rock' photo!
thingsToDoFromEditors: Take the classic 'pushing the rock' optical illusion photo
Continue to South Bubble summit for panoramic Jordan Pond views

name: Beehive Trail Summit
address:
Beehive Trail
Bar Harbor, ME, USA 04609
about: Thrilling hike featuring iron rungs and ladders on exposed cliff faces.
notesFromOthers: Not for those afraid of heights - exhilarating climb!
Start early to beat the crowds
The views from the top are absolutely worth the climb
thingsToDoFromEditors: Arrive before 7am to avoid waiting at the iron rungs sections
Wear gloves for better grip on the metal rungs and ladders

name: Beal's Lobster Pier
address:
182 Clark Point Rd
Southwest Harbor, ME, USA 04679
about: Classic Maine seafood shack serving fresh lobster rolls with harbor views since 1985.
notesFromOthers: Best lobster roll in Maine - get the warm butter version!
Picnic tables overlook the working harbor
Cash only, but there's an ATM on site
thingsToDoFromEditors: Order the warm buttered lobster roll over cold mayo version
Bring cash - they don't take cards but have an ATM nearby

name: McKay's Public House
address:
231 Main St
Bar Harbor, ME, USA 04609
about: Beloved Irish-style pub known for cozy atmosphere and craft beers.
notesFromOthers: The fish and chips are outstanding!
Great beer selection - try a local Maine brew
Live music on weekends creates an amazing vibe
thingsToDoFromEditors: Order fish & chips with a local Maine beer like Allagash or Shipyard
Check their schedule for live music nights on weekends
